article_title: Andy Kessler: Living the California Nanny-State Life
article_text: The other day my family stopped for frozen yogurt in Palo Alto. Ice cream in Silicon Valley is frowned upon these days, even though froyo tends to taste more like soap than a scoop of butter pecan. Waiting to pay, I watched a young man wearing a Vampire Weekend T-shirt cut the line, go to the counter, and ask whether he should put his garbage in the compost, recycle or landfill container. "Well, any leftover toppings go into compost. The spoon and cup can be recycled. But the plastic top and bag, unfortunately, need to go to landfill," said the employee. There was a line at the trash, each a victim, it...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Andy Kessler asks: Are you into reusable bags, recycling, fluorescent bulbs and going by the rules? Then California is the place for you.
twitter.title: Andy Kessler: Living the California Nanny-State Life

The other day my family stopped for frozen yogurt in Palo Alto.
There was a line at the trash, each a victim, it...
Ice cream in Silicon Valley is frowned upon these days, even though froyo tends to taste more like soap than a scoop of butter pecan.
But the plastic top and bag, unfortunately, need to go to landfill," said the employee.
Waiting to pay, I watched a young man wearing a Vampire Weekend T-shirt cut the line, go to the counter, and ask whether he should put his garbage in the compost, recycle or landfill container.
